item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, May 20, 2025 at 12:35 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Reports of Deno's Demise Have Been Greatly Exaggerated (50 points | 39 comments)
2. Using elliptic curves to solve a math meme (107 points | 12 comments)
3. A simple search engine from scratch (60 points | 1 comment)
4. The Behavior of LLMs in Hiring Decisions: Systemic Biases in Candidate Selection (83 points | 54 comments)
5. Making Video Games (Without an Engine) in 2025 (255 points | 96 comments)
6. The Windows Subsystem for Linux is now open source (1397 points | 934 comments)
7. DDoSecrets publishes 410 GB of heap dumps, hacked from TeleMessage (492 points | 131 comments)
8. Have I Been Pwned 2.0 (646 points | 203 comments)
9. Show HN: Text to 3D simulation on a map [does history pretty well] (3 points | 1 comment)
10. Show HN: JavaFactory – IntelliJ plugin to generate Java code (7 points | discuss)
11. Finland announces migration of its rail network to international gauge (255 points | 216 comments)
12. Jules: An Asynchronous Coding Agent (376 points | 152 comments)
13. Why Does the U.S. Always Run a Trade Deficit? (27 points | 29 comments)
14. GitHub Copilot Coding Agent (476 points | 298 comments)
15. I got fooled by AI-for-science hype–here's what it taught me (204 points | 154 comments)
16. What are people doing? Live-ish estimates based on global population dynamics (171 points | 77 comments)
17. Questioning Representational Optimism in Deep Learning (26 points | 2 comments)
18. Claude Code SDK (375 points | 164 comments)
19. Launch HN: Better Auth (YC X25) – Authentication Framework for TypeScript (224 points | 83 comments)
20. Imagine a drive where every file exists as all file types all of the time (7 points | 14 comments)
21. Run GitHub Actions locally (251 points | 103 comments)
22. Ann, the Small Annotation Server (56 points | 9 comments)
23. Biff – a batteries-included web framework for Clojure (57 points | 16 comments)
24. Kilo: A text editor in less than 1000 LOC with syntax highlight and search (159 points | 30 comments)
25. Game theory illustrated by an animated cartoon game (322 points | 52 comments)
26. Solving physics-based initial value problems with unsupervised machine learning (17 points | 3 comments)
27. Linguists Find Proof of Sweeping Language Pattern Once Deemed a 'Hoax' (11 points | 8 comments)
28. A man who visited every country in the world without boarding a plane (2023) (74 points | 39 comments)
29. A shower thought turned into a Collatz visualization (119 points | 20 comments)
30. The forbidden railway: Vienna-Pyongyang (2008) (206 points | 72 comments)
